titleStmt.title: IN GALFRIDI WHITNEI EMBLEMATA, STEPHANI LIMBERTI ANGLI NOR∣DOVICENSIS Scholae Magistri Decastichon.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: IN GALFRIDI WHITNEI EMBLEMATA, STEPHANI LIMBERTI ANGLI NOR∣DOVICENSIS Scholae Magistri Decastichon.

monogr.title: A choice of emblemes, and other deuises, for the moste parte gathered out of sundrie writers, Englished and moralized. And diuers newly deuised, by Geffrey Whitney. A worke adorned with varietie of matter, both pleasant and profitable: wherein those that please, maye finde to fit their fancies: bicause herein, by the office of the eie, and the eare, the minde maye reape dooble delighte throughe holsome preceptes, shadowed with pleasant deuises: both fit for the vertuous, to their incoraging: and for the wicked, for their admonishing and amendment
monogr.author: Whitney, Geffrey

keywords.term: Adages, aphorisms, emblem books, jests, proverbs

div.head: IN GALFRIDI WHITNEI EMBLEMATA, STEPHANI LIMBERTI ANGLI NORDOVICENSIS Scholae Magistri Decastichon.
div.l: Si Deus hic nobis, teste Platone, daret:
Cuius vel Phoebo pulchrius ora nitent?
Non Veneris, Triuiae nec certet forma Dianae,
Huius at effigiem WHITNAEI Emblemata pingunt,
Zeuxide, vel docto dignus Apelle, labor.
Consulet ergo boni multum spectabilis Heros
Et capiet facili talia dona manu.
